question: A valve in the cylinder shown in <image 1> has a cross-sectional area of 11 cm2 with a pressure of 735 kPa inside the cylinder and 99 kPa outside.How large a force is needed to open the valve?
description: The image depicts a cylindrical container with a valve at the top. The valve has a cross-sectional area labeled \( A_{\text{valve}} \). Inside the cylinder, there is a pressure labeled \( P_{\text{cyl}} \), and outside the cylinder, there is a pressure labeled \( P_{\text{outside}} \). The valve is shown in a closed position, and there is a force required to open it. The pressures inside and outside the cylinder are given as 735 kPa and 99 kPa, respectively. The cross-sectional area of the valve is given as 11 cm².
